name: Dr. Ambedkar Medical Aid Scheme (Revised – 2009)
description: The scheme “Dr. Ambedkar Medical Aid Scheme” has been revised and implemented by the Directorate of Welfare of Scheduled Caste & Backward Classes, Government of Haryana in 2009. The scheme is meant to provide medical treatment facilities to patients suffering from serious ailments requiring surgery of the Kidney, Heart, Liver, Cancer, and Brain or any other life-threatening diseases including Knee surgery and Spinal surgery to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe persons whose annual family income is less than ₹ 1,00,000/- per annum and will be implemented through the following Hospitals:• All India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi.• Sanjay Gandhi Post Graduate Institute, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh.• Patna Medical College Hospital, Patna, Bihar.• Jabalpur Hospital and Research Centre, Jabalpur, Madhya Pradesh.• B. Barua Cancer Institute, Guwahati, Assam.• Birla Heart Foundation, Kolkata, West Bengal.• Kalinga Hospital Ltd. Chandrashekharpur, Bhubaneswar, Orissa.• Tata Cancer Research Institute, Mumbai, Maharashtra.• Nizam Institute of Medical Sciences, Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh.• The Voluntary Health Services, Chennai.• All CGHS-approved Hospitals as revised from time to time by the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Government of India.• All State Government Medical Colleges attached Hospitals even if not included under CGHS Scheme.• All State Hospitals.• All Hospitals recognized by State Government.• All Hospitals are fully funded by either the Central Government or the State Governments.• All Government Hospitals in District Headquarters/ major towns where surgery or treatment facility for Kidney, Heart, Liver Cancer, and Brain or any other life-threatening disease including knee surgery and spinal surgery is available.• In exceptional cases where the Chairperson is personally convinced of the genuineness and justification for the need to cover any Hospital outside the approved list, can be approached for eligible treatment. Disbursement:1. 75% of the estimated cost of the treatment will be directly released to the concerned Hospital, with a maximum ceiling limit of ₹ 1,00,000/- in each case, in the form of a crossed cheque/ DD.2. The 50% of the total admissible medical aid will be paid, in advance, directly to the Hospital before surgery as the first installment.3. The remaining 50% amount will be released to the concerned Hospital after the surgery, on submission of the final bills duly certified by the Medical Superintendent of the said Hospital.4. Further, medical aid from the foundation and other sources should not exceed the total estimated cost of the treatment. A certificate in this regard should be obtained from the Medical Superintendent of the concerned Hospital.5. The Estimated Cost certificate to be submitted along with the application should contain the date fixed for the surgical operation.
benefits: Under this scheme medical treatment facilities provide to the patients suffering from serious ailments of Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe persons whose annual family income is less than ₹ 1
000/- p.a.A patient having serious ailments requiring surgery of the Kidney
Heart
Liver
Cancer
Knee
Spinal and Brain
or any other life-threatening diseases may be given treatment.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant shall belong to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe Community.Annual family income shall not exceed ₹ 1
000/- per annum.Those who are suffering from major ailments which need surgery such as kidney
heart
liver
cancer
brain or any other life-threatening disease including knee surgery and spinal surgery.
required_documents: Original Estimated Cost certificate duly signed by the Medical Superintendent of the concerned hospital.Original or attested photocopies of the income certificate
caste certificate

and ration card of the patient.The application should be recommended and forwarded either by a local sitting Member of Parliament (Lok Sabha or Rajya Sabha) or by the District Magistrate & Collectors/Deputy Commissioner of the concerned District or the Secretary in-charge of Health & Social Welfare Departments of State/UT.Medical aid from the Foundation and other sources should not exceed the total estimated cost of the treatment. A certificate in this regard should be obtained from the Medical Superintendent of the concerned Hospital.The Estimated Cost Certificate
accompanied with the application
should contain the date fixed for the surgical operation as far as possible.An attested photograph of the patient should be affixed on the Application Form.

faqs.question: What is the scope of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, the state government provides medical treatment facilities to patients suffering from serious ailments to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe persons whose annual family income is less than ₹ 1,00,000/- per annum.

faqs.question: What are the types of medical treatments provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Patients having serious ailments requiring surgery of the Kidney, Heart, Liver, Cancer, Knee, Spinal, and Brain, or any other life-threatening diseases may be provided treatment under this scheme.

faqs.question: How much amount of the treatment will be directly released to the concerned Hospital?
faqs.answer: The 75% of the estimated cost of the treatment will be directly released to the concerned Hospital, with a maximum ceiling limit of ₹1,00,000/- in each case, in the form of a crossed cheque / DD.

faqs.answer: The 50% of the total admissible medical aid will be paid, in advance, directly to the Hospital before surgery as the first installment. faqs.answer: The applicant shall apply for medical aid in the prescribed application form, duly certified by the Medical Superintendent of the concerned Hospital.

faqs.answer: Yes, the duly filled-in form should reach the Director, Dr. Ambedkar Foundation, 15, Janpath, New Delhi, at least 15 days before the date of surgery.

faqs.answer: All the applications received will be processed by Dr. Ambedkar Foundation.

branch name and IFSC code.Disease related Details.Doctor's certificate on format.Medicines original bill.Certificate of being an unmarried daughter or a daughter below 21 years of age.

name: Hita-dhikaari Ke Samanye Athava Durghatana Me Mrityu Ya Ghayal Hone Ki Dasha Me Sahayata Yojana
description: The Beneficiary's Death or Injury Assistance Scheme, established by the Labor department of Rajasthan State, is a compassionate government program designed to offer a helping hand to families of beneficiaries who have experienced the loss of a loved one or the sudden hardship of an injury, regardless of whether the cause was natural or accidental. Recognizing the significant emotional and financial strain that such events can inflict, this initiative aims to provide a measure of financial security during these difficult times, allowing families to focus on healing and rebuilding their lives.
benefits: In case of death due to accident : ₹5
000/-In case of permanent total disability due to accident : ₹3
000/-Permanent total disability means disabling of two eyes or both hands or both legs due to accident.In case of partial permanent disability due to accident : ₹1
000/-Permanent partial disability means disabling of one hand or one leg.In case of serious injury in an accident : Up to ₹20

000/- (Serious injury in an accident means the beneficiary being admitted as an in-patient in the hospital for at least 5 days. The determination of serious injury will be decided based on the certificate issued by the Medical Board .)In case of minor injuries in an accident : Up to ₹5
000/-Minor injuries means hospitalization as an inpatient in a hospital for less than 5 daysIn case of normal death of a construction worker : ₹75
eligibility_criteria: Construction workers must be between 18 to 60 years of age.Construction workers must be registered with the labor board.Construction worker must be depositing their contributions regularly.
required_documents: Copy of discharge ticket from hospital in case of accident.Copy of mortuary report or FIR in case of accidental death.Death certificate issued by the registered authority in case of death.Certificate from the employer/employer of the place where the worker worked.Copy of beneficiary registration identity card or card.Copy of Bhamshah family card or Bhamshah nomination.Copy of Aadhar Card.Copy of first page of bank account passbook.

name: Financial Assistance for the Treatment of Blind, Disabled, Deaf, Dumb, or Mentally Challenged Ex-Servicemen and their Dependents (Wife and Children)
description: The "Financial Assistance for the Treatment of Blind, Disabled, Deaf, Dumb, or Mentally Challenged Ex-Servicemen and their Dependents (Wife and Children)" scheme was launched by the Department of Sainik Welfare, Government of Rajasthan. The scheme aims to provide monthly financial assistance for the treatment of ex-servicemen and their dependents (wife & children) who have a disability of 40% or more and are suffering from serious illnesses such as cancer, leprosy, tuberculosis, kidney and cardiac ailments, paralysis, etc. Only an ex-serviceman of the rank of Havildar or below or a member of the family of an ex-serviceman whose disability is 40% or more is eligible to apply. This scheme came into effect on 01.07.2020, and financial assistance will be granted from the first day of the month in which the application is approved.
benefits: Financial Assistance:S. No.Percentage of DisabilityFinancial AssistancePriority180% and above₹3
000/- per monthFirst Priority260% but less than 80%₹2
000/- per monthSecond Priority340% but less than 60%₹1
000/- per monthThird PriorityNote:The assistance is provided for three years. After that

the applicant will re-apply for renewal.The financial aid is disbursed online through the District Sainik Welfare Office.A maximum of two disabled family members of an ex-serviceman can avail of this benefit.The financial assistance will cease upon the death of the disabled ex-serviceman or the disabled family member.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.The applicant should either be an ex-serviceman as defined by the Government of India or a dependent family member (excluding parents) of ex-serviceman.Only an ex-serviceman holding the rank of Havildar or below
or their family members
are eligible to apply.The ex-serviceman or their dependent should have a disability of 40% or more.Both pensioner and non-pensioner are eligible. However

ex-serviceman who is already receiving a disability pension from the Army cannot apply for financial assistance for himself based on their disability. He may apply on behalf of a disabled family member with 40% or more disability.Under this scheme
the family members do not include parents. Only wife/widow
son/daughter are included.The ex-serviceman’s disability will be considered valid regardless of whether it occurred during military service or after retirement.The name of the disabled wife
son
or daughter should be recorded in the discharge book or Part II Order of the ex-serviceman.Assistance will not be provided to more than two members of the same family
including the ex-serviceman.A valid recommendation from the District Sainik Welfare Officer (DSWO) is mandatory.
required_documents: Discharge Book/Service ParticularsDisability Certificate issued by a competent medical authorityEx-Serviceman/Widow/Dependent ID Card issued by the District Sainik Welfare OfficePension Payment Order (PPO)
if applicableDeath Certificate (in case of deceased ex-serviceman or widow)Aadhaar Card of the applicantBank Passbook CopyAny other documents as required

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Ex-servicemen (Havildar or below) and their dependents with a disability of 40% or more who do not receive an Army disability pension.

faqs.question: What is the financial assistance provided?
faqs.answer: ₹1,000 to ₹3,000 per month based on the level of disability.﻿﻿﻿﻿

faqs.question: How long is the assistance provided?
faqs.answer: The assistance is provided for three years, with renewal options.

faqs.question: Can more than one dependent apply?
faqs.answer: Yes, but only up to two dependents per family.

faqs.question: How is the payment made?
faqs.answer: Online transfer through the District Sainik Welfare Office.

faqs.question: Is there any residency requirement?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant must be a resident of Rajasthan.

faqs.question: How is the priority determined?
faqs.answer: Based on the level of disability: 80%+ (First), 60-80% (Second), 40-60% (Third).

faqs.question: Is there a limit on the number of beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme is limited to 300 beneficiaries at a time.

faqs.question: How can one apply?
faqs.answer: Submit an application to the District Sainik Welfare Office with the required documents.﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿﻿

faqs.question: What documents are required?
faqs.answer: Discharge book, disability certificate, ID proof, bank details, and other supporting documents.

faqs.question: When does the scheme become effective?
faqs.answer: The scheme was effective from July 1, 2020.﻿

name: Home for Visually Challenged Person
description: The scheme “Home for Visually challenged Person" was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. The objective of this scheme is to take care of the male persons who are visually impaired and who lack care and protection in society and are deprived of basic needs like food, shelter, clothes.
benefits: Free Food and Shelter.Free Supply of Daily Living Needs.Pocket Money of ₹ 5/-.Vocational Training Such as Korai & Coir Mat Weaving
According to Their Interest. Labour Charges of ₹ 20 /- for Mat.Recreations Such as TV
Radio
Musical Instrument
Besides Local Trips to Places of Interest and Temples. Annual Tour to Places of Interest. NOTE: Contact the authorities below in case of delay in disbursal of benefits:Puducherry: The Director
Directorate of Social Welfare
Saradhambal Nagar
Ellaipillaichavadhy
Puducherry. Karaikal: The Collector
Karaikal.Mahe/Yanam: The Regional Administrator
Mahe/Yanam.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should have a total absence of sight.The applicant should have a visual acuity not exceeding 6/60 or 20/200 in the better eye with correcting lenses. The applicant should have a limitation of field of vision sub standing an angle of 20 degree.The applicant should be above 20 years of age.﻿
required_documents: Aadhaar Card.Voter ID.Address Proof.Ration Card.Age Proof.Disability Certificate.

faqs.question: What is the primary objective of the "Home for Visually Challenged Person" scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to provide care and protection to visually impaired male individuals who lack basic necessities.

faqs.question: What are the key benefits offered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries receive free food and shelter, daily living needs, ₹5 pocket money, and vocational training in activities like Korai & Coir Mat Weaving.

faqs.question: What is the vocational training provided, and how does it align with the beneficiaries' interests?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries undergo vocational training, including Korai & Coir Mat Weaving, tailored to their individual interests.

faqs.question: How are the labor charges for mat weaving addressed under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides a labor charge of ₹20 for the production of mats by the visually impaired individuals.

faqs.question: Besides basic needs, what recreational activities are offered to beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: Recreational activities include access to TV, radio, musical instruments, local trips, and an annual tour to places of interest.

faqs.question: What should an applicant do in case there is a delay in receiving the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: In case of delays, applicants can contact designated authorities based on their location in Puducherry, Karaikal, Mahe, or Yanam.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria regarding the absence of sight for applicants?
faqs.answer: The primary eligibility criterion is the total absence of sight for individuals seeking benefits under the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the acceptable visual acuity for applicants under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants should have a visual acuity not exceeding 6/60 or 20/200 in the better eye with correcting lenses.

faqs.question: What is the specified limitation for the field of vision for an applicant to be eligible?
faqs.answer: Eligible applicants should have a limitation of field of vision, substantiated by an angle of 20 degrees.

faqs.question: Is there an age requirement for individuals to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicants should be above 20 years of age to qualify for the "Home for Visually Challenged Person" scheme.

faqs.question: What geographical areas are covered under the scheme's contact points for delayed benefits?
faqs.answer: The contact points for delayed benefits include Puducherry, Karaikal, Mahe, and Yanam, each with designated authorities.

faqs.question: Are female visually impaired individuals eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme specifically focuses on visually impaired male individuals for care and support.

faqs.question: Can beneficiaries choose the vocational training based on their personal preferences?
faqs.answer: Yes, vocational training is customized according to the individual interests of visually impaired beneficiaries.

faqs.question: Is there a provision for annual outings for the beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme includes an annual tour to places of interest as part of the recreational activities offered.

faqs.question: How does the scheme contribute to the overall well-being of visually impaired individuals?
faqs.answer: The scheme addresses the holistic well-being by providing not just basic needs but also vocational training, recreational activities, and social engagement for the beneficiaries.

name: Annual Medical Assistance Scheme (BBOCWWB)
description: The "Annual Medical Assistance Scheme" by the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Resources Department, Government of Bihar, provides a yearly financial assistance of ₹3,000/- to the construction workers who are registered with the Board.
benefits: Financial Assistance of ₹3
000/- per annum.

faqs.question: What type of work should the applicant be engaged in to qualify for the financial assistance scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant should be engaged in building or construction work to be eligible for the financial assistance.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for the applicant to be registered with the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant must be registered with the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board to qualify for the scheme.

name: Dulari Scheme
description: The “Dulari Scheme” was launched by the Health Department, Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands on 26th January, 2013 to give incentives to newborn baby girls and girl children on passing VIII, X & XII standards. As per the present scheme, the girl child born on or after 26.01.2013 will be eligible to get the benefit under the scheme for birth incentives and the girl children who are below 13 years of age not registered under the Planned family scheme (old scheme) will also get the benefit of this scheme.
benefits: As per the scheme
the following benefits are given to the girl child whose parents are domicile of Andaman & Nicobar Islands:Sl. No.DescriptionsAmount of Assistance1Benefits at Birth- Institution deliver₹8
000/-﻿Benefits at Birth- Home delivery₹5
000/-2Benefits on passing VIIIth Standard₹5
000/-3Benefits on passing Xth Standard₹10
000/-4Benefits on passing XIIth Standard₹10
000/-5Benefits on getting married at the age of 21 years₹5
000/-6Benefits on getting married after age of 25 years₹10
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a domicile of the Union Territory of Andaman & Nicobar Islands.The applicant should be a woman or girl child to avail the benefits under the scheme.The incentive is being given to those who are born on or after 01.10.2013.The girl children between 0-13 years born before the implementation of the Dulari Scheme and not covered under the Planned Family Scheme shall be given only the educational incentives after passing the VIII Standard which will be fixed in the bank. The amount cannot be drawn before attaining the 18-year age of the girl child or any other rule passed by the A&N Administration.Cessation of Benefits:The benefits will be ceased if the parent or beneficiary provides a falls/concealing statement/certificate.If the child gets married at an early age i.e. before 21 years of age no further benefit will be given.The girl becomes a school dropout (for further benefits only given for education).If the child dies due to any reason before attaining the required age of disbursal of incentive the Directorate of Health Services (DHS) may pass an order to prematurely close the deposit and the amount may be applicable may be given to the parents.
required_documents: Identity proof of parent (s) i.e. Aadhaar CardPassport-size photograph of parent (s)Birth Certificate of childLocal certificate/domicile certificate/permanent resident certificate Ration Card of FamilyAddress proof of the parent(s)Mark sheet of Class XIII/X/XII
if applicableBonafide certificate from the school or school leaving certificate
if applicableMarriage registration certificate
if applicableBank account details/Copy of passbookAny other document as required

faqs.question: What is the Dulari Scheme?
faqs.answer: The 'Dulari Scheme' is a government initiative launched by the Health Department of the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands on January 26, 2013, aimed at providing various benefits to women and their girl children.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for benefits under the Scheme?
faqs.answer: Parents domiciled in Andaman & Nicobar Islands with girl children born on or after January 26, 2013, are eligible for benefits. Additionally, girl children between 0-13 years born before October 1, 2013, and not covered under the previous Planned Family Scheme are also eligible.

faqs.question: What are the benefits provided under the Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides benefits at birth, educational milestones (VIII, X, and XII standards), and upon marriage at the ages of 21 and 25.

faqs.question: How much are the benefits for institutional delivery?
faqs.answer: For institutional delivery, the benefit is ₹8,000/-.

faqs.question: What is the benefit amount for home delivery?
faqs.answer: For home delivery, the benefit is ₹5,000/-.

faqs.question: How much is the benefit upon passing the VIII standard?
faqs.answer: The benefit upon passing VIII standard is ₹5,000/-.

faqs.question: What benefits are provided upon passing X and XII standards?
faqs.answer: Upon passing X standard, the benefit is ₹10,000/-, and upon passing XII standard, it is also ₹10,000/-.

faqs.question: Are there benefits provided for marriage under the Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, there are benefits upon marriage. ₹5,000/- is given upon marriage at the age of 21, and ₹10,000/- is given if married after the age of 25.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for availing benefits under the Scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligibility includes having parents domiciled in Andaman & Nicobar Islands and being born on or after January 26, 2013.

faqs.question: What leads to the cessation of benefits under the Dulari Scheme?
faqs.answer: Benefits will cease if false information is provided, if the child marries before the age of 21, if the child becomes a school dropout, or if the child passes away before reaching the age for benefit disbursal.

faqs.question: Is there any penalty for providing false information?
faqs.answer: Yes, benefits will cease if false or misleading information is provided by the parent or beneficiary.

faqs.question: How can I apply for benefits under the Scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible applicant can register and apply under the scheme through the online Portal: https://serviceonline.gov.in/

name: Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund - Medical Help

deaf and dumb children up to the age of 6 years

faqs.question: Who Can Apply For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Individual from Non BPL whose family income should be atleast 2lakhs per annum

faqs.question: What is the objective of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Rajasthan Chief Minister’s Relief Fund – medical help scheme launched on April 1999 under Chief Minister’s Relief Fund in Rajasthan for the Dependents of untimely dead due to famine, floods, excessive rains, fires and accidental accidents help.

faqs.question: How it will help for treatment at hospital?
faqs.answer: Assistance is accepted in recognized private hospitals from the major Government/ Chief Minister’s Relief Fund of the state. 40% maximum amount of rs1.50 lakh in government hospitals and 30% maximum amount of Rs 90,000 in recognized private hospitals, whichever is less, is accepted and sent to the concerned hospital.

faqs.question: How this scheme help to get medical help?
faqs.answer:
1. One time full payment by Demand draft or Direct bank transfer
2. Cochlear Implant Surgery of Deaf and Dumb Children - In the state of Rajasthan, deaf and dumb children up to the age of 6 years, whose family income is up to Rs. 2.00 lakh annually,
3. Assistance for Thalassemia Major Disease Treatment - 2 percent assistance is given from the Chief Minister's Assistance Fund up to Rs. 50.7 lakh

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer:

2. The Annal Income of the Family should be greater than 2 LPA
3. Not be listed in ABMGRSBY

faqs.question: Which documents are required to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer:
1. Income Certificate Copy* 
2. Address Proof Copy*
3. Rashan Card
4. Treatment Estimate by Doctor
5. Medical Certificate

faqs.question: How to apply for this scheme
faqs.answer:
1. Visit the official website of the Chief Minister Relief Fund Rajasthan at https://cmrf.rajasthan.gov.in/.
2. Click on the "Apply for Medical Help" option on the homepage.
3. You will be directed to a new page where you need to select the "Apply Online" option.
4. Fill in the required details such as your name, address, contact details, medical condition, and required treatment.
5. Upload the necessary documents such as medical certificates, doctor's reports, and bills.
6. Once you have filled in all the details, click on the "Submit" button.
7. After submitting the application, you will receive an acknowledgment number that you can use to track the status of your application.
Alternatively, you can also apply offline by downloading the application form from the website and submitting it along with the necessary documents to the Chief Minister Relief Fund office.

name: Sruthitharangam ( Cochlear Implantation Scheme )
description: The Government of Kerala launched the “Sruthitharangam (Cochlear Implantation Scheme)” under Kerala Social Security Mission by the Social Justice Department, Kerala. This scheme envisioned providing free cochlear implantation surgery for children in the age group of 0-5 years, who are hearing impaired. The early identification and intervention procedures initiated within six months of age should be the golden standard for the holistic development of a child with hearing loss. Cochlear Implant is a proven option for the treatment of profound hearing loss. The child from poor families whose annual family income is below ₹2 lakhs are eligible to get the benefit of this scheme. This scheme is implemented through Government as well as selected empaneled private hospitals in this field. The objective of this scheme is to provide a cochlear implant to children selected by Regional and State level technical committees for cochlear implantation and to provide financial support for Auditory Verbal Habilitation (AVH) to operate children through empaneled hospitals/centers.Hospitals Covered Under the Scheme:Govt. Medical College Hospital, Trivandrum.Govt. Medical College Hospital, Kozhikode.Govt. Medical College Hospital, Kottayam.KIMS Hospital, Trivandrum.Medical Trust Hospital, Kochi.Dr. Noushad’s ENT Institute and Research Centre, Ernakulam.West Fort Hi-Tech Hospital, Thrissur.Dr. Manoj’s ENT Super Speciality Institute & Research Centre, Kozhikode.MIMS Hospital, Kozhikode.ASCENT ENT Hospital, Perinthalmanna
benefits: Under the scheme
children who are hearing impaired will be provided free cochlear implantation surgery.Note: The children will be selected by Regional and State level technical committees for cochlear implantation.
eligibility_criteria: 1.	The applicant should be a resident of Kerala State.2.	The child who is hearing impaired is eligible under the scheme. 3.	The child should be in the age group of 0-3 years.4.	The annual family income of the applicant should be below ₹2 Lakhs.Note: The Screening Committee would be empowered to make exceptions beyond 3 years and up to 5 years of age on a case-to-case basis; where the committee feels that a high possibility of success exists or if there are other compelling technical reasons warranting or making an exception.
required_documents: 1.	Proof of Identity 2.	Proof of age of the child3.	Income certificate4.	Copy of BPL card (if applicable)5.	Copy of Ration card (if applicable)6.	Residence certificate7.	Passport-size photograph8.	Child’s medical reports

faqs.question: What is the “Sruthitharangam Scheme”?
faqs.answer: This scheme envisioned providing free cochlear implantation surgery for children in the age group of 0-5 years, who are hearing impaired. The early identification and intervention procedures initiated within six months of age should be the golden standard for the holistic development of a child with hearing loss. Cochlear Implant is a proven option for the treatment of profound hearing loss. The child from poor families whose annual family income is below ₹2 lakhs are eligible to get the benefit of this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of this scheme is to provide a cochlear implant to children selected by Regional and State level technical committees for cochlear implantation and to provide financial support for Auditory Verbal Habilitation (AVH) to operate children through empaneled hospitals/centers.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, children who are hearing impaired will be provided free cochlear implantation surgery.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Children who are hearing impaired are eligible under the scheme.

faqs.question: Can all the hearing-impaired children avail of the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, The children will be selected by Regional and State level technical committees for cochlear implantation.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for hearing-impaired patients?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is only for hearing-impaired patients.

faqs.question: What is the income criterion to avail of the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The annual family income of the applicant should be below ₹2 Lakhs.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Kerala?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a resident of Kerala State.

faqs.question: What is the age limit to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant/child should be in the age group of 0-3 years.

faqs.question: Can a hearing-impaired child above the age of 3 years also eligible to avail of the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Screening Committee would be empowered to make exceptions beyond 3 years and up to 5 years of age on a case-to-case basis; where the committee feels that a high possibility of success exists or if there are other compelling technical reasons warranting or making an exception.

faqs.question: Is this scheme implemented only in Government Hospitals?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme is implemented through Government as well as selected empaneled private hospitals in this field.

name: Medical Assistance (A.B.O.C.W.W.B)

Under this scheme, medical assistance shall be provided to the Building & Other Construction Workers who are registered under A.B.O.C.W.W.B during hospitalization, partial disability, and for critical diseases such as Cancer, Heart attack (bypass surgery), Failure of kidney (kidney transplantation), Liver cirrhosis, etc. as per decision of the Board. Medical assistance shall be provided to the beneficiaries immediately after registration.

000/- per day for the first 5 days hospitalized + ₹200/- each for the remaining days of hospitalized subject to maximum ₹20
000/-.Registered beneficiaries also avail of partial disability benefits of ₹25
000/- and ₹1.50 Lakhs on the percentage of disability upto 25%

Heart attack (bypass surgery)

faqs.question: What is the Medical Assistance Scheme offered by the Assam Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (A.B.O.C.W.W.B)?
faqs.answer: The Medical Assistance Scheme is an initiative launched by A.B.O.C.W.W.B, Labour Welfare Department, Government of Assam. It aims to provide medical assistance to registered Building & Other Construction Workers during hospitalization, partial disability, and for critical diseases such as Cancer, Heart attack (bypass surgery), Failure of kidney (kidney transplantation), Liver cirrhosis, etc.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for medical assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Building & Other Construction Workers who are registered under A.B.O.C.W.W.B are eligible for medical assistance under this scheme.

faqs.question: When will the medical assistance be provided to the beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: Medical assistance shall be provided to the beneficiaries immediately after registration with the Board.

faqs.question: What are the benefits offered under the Medical Assistance Scheme?
faqs.answer:
A. Medical Assistance: ₹1,000/- per day for the first 5 days hospitalized + ₹200/- each for the remaining days of hospitalized subject to a maximum of ₹20,000/-.

b. Partial Disability Benefit: Registered beneficiaries can avail benefits of ₹25,000/-, ₹50,000/-, ₹75,000/-, and ₹1.50 Lakhs based on the percentage of disability - up to 25%, up to 50%, up to 80%, and more than 80% respectively.

c. Critical Diseases Coverage: ₹1.50 Lakhs for critical diseases such as Cancer, Heart attack (bypass surgery), Failure of kidney (kidney transplantation), Liver cirrhosis, etc., as per the decision of the Board.

faqs.question: What is the maximum limit for hospitalization benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The maximum limit for hospitalization benefits is ₹20,000/-, including ₹1,000/- per day for the first 5 days hospitalized and ₹200/- each for the remaining days.

faqs.question: How are critical diseases determined for coverage under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Critical diseases such as Cancer, Heart attack (bypass surgery), Failure of kidney (kidney transplantation), Liver cirrhosis, etc., are covered based on the decision of the Board.

faqs.question: What are the residency requirements for workers?
faqs.answer: Workers must be permanent residents of Assam to be eligible for the Medical Assistance Scheme.

faqs.question: Is there an age limit for applicants?
faqs.answer: Yes, the age of the worker applying for the scheme should be between 18 to 55 years.

faqs.question: Can a worker apply for the scheme if they are registered with another welfare board in a different state?
faqs.answer: No, applicants must be registered specifically with the Assam Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board to be eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: How to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible beneficiaries may apply through the portal. https://abocwwb.assam.gov.in/

name: Medical Assistance Scheme (PBAOCWWB)
description: The "Medical Assistance" is a Welfare Scheme by the Puducherry Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Union Territory of Puducherry. Through this scheme, the Board may sanction financial assistance to the Construction Workers who are hospitalized for five or more days due to an accident or any disease. The financial assistance shall be ₹500/- for the first 5 days and ₹50/- each for the remaining days, subject to a maximum of ₹1,500/-.
benefits: Financial Assistance of ₹500/- for initial minimum period of 5 days and thereafter ₹50/- per day upto maximum of ₹1500/- per month
credited within 15 days through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a citizen of India.The applicant should be registered as a Construction Worker with the Puducherry Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.The applicant should have completed the age of 18 years.The applicant should not have completed the age of 60 years during the preceding 12 months in the construction work.The beneficiary should be contributing to the Board's Fund.The applicant should not have defaulted in payment of contribution to the Board for a continuous period of more than one year.The applicant should have been hospitalized for five or more days due to an accident or any disease.
required_documents: For Registration1. Duly Filled and Signed Application Form.2. Birth Certificate/Transfer Certificate/Doctor Certificate for Age Verification.3. Experience Certificate to Be Obtained From a Registered Engineer/contractor/association/trade Union

Serving as Evidence of Being a Construction Worker.4. Details Related to Construction Work/worksite.5. Proof of Blood Group (Medical Health Card or Laboratory Certificate).6. Two Passport-size Photographs.7. Ration Card.8. Aadhaar Card.9. Bank Details.10. Family Particulars/status and Nomination Details of the Beneficiaries.11. Certificate From the Revenue Department or Social Welfare Department or Anganwadi Officials of the Respective Area.﻿For ApplicationLast Subscription Bill.Board ID cardAadhaar CardBank Passbook.Medical Certificate issued by the competent authority (RMO).Prescription Slip or Treatment Card.Discharge Slip.

faqs.question: Can a construction worker with a lapse in contribution still be eligible?
faqs.answer: No, the beneficiary should be contributing to the Board's Fund, and there should not be a default in payment of contribution for more than one year.

faqs.question: What happens if a worker is hospitalized for less than five days?
faqs.answer: The scheme is applicable for construction workers hospitalized for five or more days due to accident or any disease.

faqs.question: Is there an age limit for applying for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant should not have completed the age of 60 years during the preceding 12 months in the construction work.

faqs.question: What if a worker has defaulted in payment previously?
faqs.answer: The applicant should not have defaulted in payment of contribution to the Board for a continuous period of more than one year.

faqs.question: What financial assistance does the Medical Assistance scheme provide?
faqs.answer: The scheme offers ₹500/- for the initial 5 days and ₹50/- per day thereafter, up to a maximum of ₹1,500/- per month, credited through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

faqs.question: How quickly are the benefits disbursed after hospitalization?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance is credited within 15 days through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) after the completion of the hospitalization period.

faqs.question: Can the financial assistance be used for purposes other than medical expenses?
faqs.answer: The assistance is specifically for construction workers hospitalized due to accident or disease, intended for covering medical expenses during that period.

faqs.question: Is there a maximum limit on the total benefits a worker can receive?
faqs.answer: The maximum benefit under the scheme is ₹1,500/- per month.

faqs.question: Are the benefits taxable?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides financial assistance, and it is advisable for beneficiaries to consult with a tax professional for information on tax implications.

faqs.question: Is there an option for a lump sum payment instead of monthly assistance?
faqs.answer: The scheme outlines a daily payment structure, and there is no provision mentioned for a lump sum payment.

faqs.question: Are there any conditions for extending the benefit period beyond 5 days?
faqs.answer: The benefit period extends beyond 5 days only if the hospitalization continues, with a daily assistance rate of ₹50/-.

faqs.question: Can the beneficiary choose the mode of receiving the financial assistance?
faqs.answer: The benefits are credited through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT), providing a secure and efficient mode of payment.

name: Financial Assistance to Poor Scheduled Caste People Suffering From Prolonged Diseases
description: The scheme “Financial Assistance to Poor Scheduled Caste People Suffering From Prolonged Diseases” was introduced by the Adi Dravidar Welfare Department, Government of Puducherry. The objective of the scheme is to provide assistance to poor patients from Scheduled Castes who are suffering from prolonged illness and unable to earn their livelihood.
benefits: Financial Assistance of ₹500/- per month.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a citizen of India.The applicant should have resided continuously in the Union Territory of Puducherry for at least five years.The applicant should be from Scheduled Caste.The applicant should be at least 18 years of age.The annual income of the applicant should not be more than ₹2
required_documents: Residence-cum-nativity Certificate.Aadhaar Card.Voter Card.Caste Certificate.Recent Passport-Size Photograph.Bank Passbook.Caste Certificate.Income Certificate.Medical Certificate.Ration Card.

faqs.question: Where can one track the status of their application for financial assistance?
faqs.answer: The status of the application can be tracked at https://edistrict.py.gov.in/User/TrackApplication.aspx.

faqs.question: In the absence of an Aadhaar Card, what alternative documents can be submitted for application?
faqs.answer: If an Aadhaar Card is unavailable, applicants can submit Aadhaar Enrolment ID along with documents like Bank Passbook, PAN Card, Passport, Voter Identity Card, or others specified by the Department.

faqs.question: Is there a contact point for further inquiries or assistance regarding the scheme?
faqs.answer: For any queries or assistance, individuals can visit https://adwelfare.py.gov.in/contact-us.

faqs.question: Can a person from a Scheduled Caste residing outside Puducherry apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, applicants must have continuous residence in the Union Territory of Puducherry for at least five years to be eligible.

faqs.question: What is the duration of financial assistance provided to eligible beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: Eligible beneficiaries receive a monthly financial assistance of ₹500/- for the duration of their prolonged illness.

faqs.question: Are there any specific guidelines regarding the submission of photographs for the application?
faqs.answer: Recent Passport-Size Photographs are required to be submitted along with the application.

faqs.question: Can a person above 60 years of age apply for financial assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, as long as the applicant is at least 18 years old, there is no upper age limit specified for eligibility.

faqs.question: Is There Any Compensation For The Delay In The Disbursal Of The Scheme Benefits?
faqs.answer: The guidelines do not mention any provision for compensation in the event of delayed disbursement of scheme benefits. Applicants should note that compensation for delays is not part of the scheme's framework.

faqs.question: Are there any specific provisions for Transgenders under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No provisions for Transgenders are mentioned in the guidelines of this scheme.

faqs.question: Can Applicants From The Neighboring States/UTs Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, this scheme is exclusively available to permanent residents of the Puducherry. Applicants from neighboring States/UTs, among others, are not eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Is there an application deadline for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme guidelines do not mention any opening date or closing date for applications.

faqs.question: Are there any specific provisions for persons with disabilities under this scheme?
faqs.answer: No provisions for persons with disabilities are mentioned in the guidelines of this scheme.
